creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: seated man in gray robes with square cap; man has faint smile; hands under sleeves in lap; inscription at L
inscription: L side of image: [Samukeredo / futari tabine wa / omoshirōki // Futari mishi / yuki wa kotoshi mo / furikeru ka] (Even when it\'s cold /  it\'s more interesting to travel / together // The snow we saw together / does it fall / this year as well? - Bashō)
markings: two-part oval intaglio, bottom center: [ 梅亭 ] {Baitei}
medium: Ink and light colors on paper
title: Bashō with two Haiku
